medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain increasing in severity, associated with nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Abdominal pain began yesterday morning and increased in severity over the course of yesterday into today. The pain is described as dull and achy, radiating to the flank.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Hypertension. 2. Hyperlipidemia. 3. Valvular heart disease (moderate AS, 1+MR, 1+TR). 4. Dilated ascending aorta (4.2 cm), ascending aorta (4.6 cm) and aortic arch (4.4 cm). 5. Atrial fibrillation. 6. Morbid obesity. 7. Diabetes mellitus. 8. Obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) on CPAP.
